intro: Hibbertia singularis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Hibbertia singularis is often found in coastal and heathland environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation efforts.
